title: Jada Pinkett Smith ‘in negotiations’ to return to The Matrix 4
text:
Jada could return as Niobe (Picture: Getty/Rex)

The Matrix sequel just keeps getting more and more exciting.

It has been claimed that Jada Pinkett Smith could be returning to the franchise alongside original stars Keanu Reeves and Carrie-Anne Moss, and we are so here for this.

Jada, 48, played Niobe in The Matrix Reloaded and Matrix Revolutions and, according to Deadline, the actress is in negotiations to reprise her role in The Matrix 4.

Niobe, who is from Zion, was the captain of the Logos hovercraft and one of the rebels in the war against the Machines and the Matrix – oh, and she’s a totally kickass martial artist.

However, it is not a done deal – so we’ll just have to hope and pray.

Jada last appeared in The Matrix Revolutions (Picture: Moviestore/REX )

Neil Patrick Harris is on board (Picture: Paul Archuleta/FilmMagic)

Two new additions to the cast, though, have been confirmed.

Neil Patrick Harris has signed on to the fourth Matrix movie, although the How I Met Your Mother star’s character has not been revealed.

And Aquaman star Yahya Abdul-Mateen II is believed to have nabbed a leading role in the project.

It was confirmed back in August that 16 years after Keanu Reeves (Neo) donned that trench coat, he would be returning alongside Carrie-Anne Moss (Trinity) in The Matrix 4, with writer and director Lana Wachowski back on board too.

Yahya Abdul-Mateen II is believed to have a leading role (Picture: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)

Both Keanu and Carrie-Anne are reprising their roles (Picture: Moviestore/REX )

Warner Bros. Picture Group chairman Toby Emmerich announced: ‘Lana is a true visionary — a singular and original creative filmmaker — and we are thrilled that she is writing, directing and producing this new chapter in The Matrix universe.’

Wachowski added: ‘Many of the ideas Lilly and I explored 20 years ago about our reality are even more relevant now.

‘I’m very happy to have these characters back in my life and grateful for another chance to work with my brilliant friends.’

While the plot has not been revealed, Keanu, 55, has teased that it will be ‘very ambitious’.

The actor has already read the script for The Matrix 4, and told Entertainment Tonight: ‘It’s very ambitious. As it should be!’
